Posts.Content: THIS IS NOT A GOOD SIGN GUYS! There have been over 526 views of this thread. No one has offered up the name of ONE drug that statistically beats the placebo in its FDA trials. Maybe we should start a research list. We could plot the FDA trials of each drug against the placebo. How about - PROVENGE XTANDI
Posts.Signature: Prostrate cancer - 5/2011 Gleason 10, PSA 121 First Lupron - 5/2011 First radiation 9/2011 (nine weeks) PSA 1.1 on 1/2012 (at the end of radiation) PSA 10.9 on 6/2012 Casodex 6/4/2012 Severe pain in hip 6/7/2012 (3 days after Casodex) PSA 25 on 7/9/2012 trouble walking, hip pain PSA 37.6 on 7/31/2012 right eye swelling and eyebrow pain Bone scan 8/14/2012 - cancer most of left hip and right eye bone. PSA 65 on 8/27/2012 Hip and eye radiated. Zometa PSA 150 Zytiga STILL ALIVE - 01/30/2013 Pain thru the roof. Business, home and 5.4 acres available for immediate sale. www.ponderosasports.com If you are heading towards stage 4 prostrate cancer, you may want to follow this womans blog about her husbands ungoing fight. http://sunshine625.hubpages.com/hub/Prostate-Cancer-Doctors-Are-Still-Clueless
Posts.Title: Challenge  name a successful prostrate drug

Posts.Content: CHALLENGE  NAME A SUCCESSFUL PROSTRATE DRUG I, like many others on this forum, would like the name of one or more castration resistant prostrate cancer drugs. With Stage 4 prostrate cancer, I have blindly followed the advice and treatment of Boises cancer experts. Nothing seems to work. It must be me. I have asked the local experts to review the drug trials on file with the FDA. Survival rates of patients taking the drugs looks like a lucky person flipping a coin. In almost every case, life expectancy of patients taking the drug is just a few months longer than the control group taking the placebo. Speak up experts -
